title:
Resource Slicing through Intelligent Orchestration of Energy-aware IoT
  services in Edge-Cloud Continuum
authors: Hafiz Faheem Shahid and Erkki Harjula
abstract:
The rapid growth of the Internet of Things (IoT) applications inflicts high
requirements for computing resources and network bandwidth. A growing number of
service providers are applying edge-cloud computing to improve the quality of
their services. Deploying IoT applications to optimal computing nodes to
minimize energy consumption and enhance system performance remains an open
challenge. In this paper, we present an intelligent orchestration concept for
breaking down IoT applications into granular microservices, called
nanoservices, and deploying them in an energy-aware manner to optimal computing
nodes in the edge-cloud continuum by applying resource and network slicing
methods. With this consolidated slicing scheme, we can efficiently allocate
network and compute resources to meet the needs of these nanoservices.
subjects: Computer Science/Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing
